decks.notes: This deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's board while simultaneously building up its own resources. It utilizes a mix of removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt, as well as creatures with powerful abilities like Ravenous Chupacabra and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes strong value engines like Jadelight Ranger and Vivien Reid to draw cards and generate additional threats. By combining aggression with a resilient game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through card advantage and board control.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to utilize powerful control cards and efficient creatures to outlast and outplay the opponent. By using counterspells like Syncopate and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Seal Away and Settle the Wreckage, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. With a mix of card draw, protection, and threats like Angel of Grace and Growth-Chamber Guardian, the deck aims to control the game and eventually overwhelm the opponent with its powerful spells and creatures.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Vraska's Contempt to control the board, while also utilizing counterspells like Syncopate and Absorb to protect its threats. The deck runs board wipes like Kaya's Wrath to reset the battlefield, as well as card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Precognitive Perception to maintain card advantage. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue its opponents, ultimately winning through card advantage and powerful finishers like Chromium, the Mutable.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with small, cheap creatures to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Cards like Deputy of Detention and Conclave Tribunal provide removal options, while Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal pump up the team. A mix of aggression and resilience is achieved with cards like Unbreakable Formation and Tithe Taker, allowing for strong board presence and protection against removal spells. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells to maintain a dominant position on the battlefield. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of card advantage and powerful planeswalker abilities provided by Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes some win conditions such as Chromium, the Mutable to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently weakened. By managing resources effectively and making strategic decisions, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thought Erasure, Discovery / Dispersal, Mortify, and Deputy of Detention, while also deploying threats like Thief of Sanity, Seraph of the Scales, and Lyra Dawnbringer to close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes cards like Hero of Precinct One and Basilica Bell-Haunt to generate value and pressure the opponent. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and value, the deck aims to control the game and secure victory through a combination of different strategies.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing aggressive creatures like Crackling Drake and Pteramander, backed up by efficient removal spells such as Shock and Lava Coil. The deck also includes card draw and filtering with cards like Opt and Chart a Course to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. Additionally, protection and counterspells like Dive Down and Spell Pierce help to protect our creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built to support the deck's UR color requirements while maximizing consistency and speed.

This deck focuses on efficiently utilizing creature and removal spells to control the board while putting pressure on the opponent with powerful aggressive creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Hydroid Krasis. It combines strong early game creatures like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker with powerful mid-to-late game threats like Vivien Reid and Find / Finality to maintain board presence and card advantage. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Cast Down, Vraska's Contempt, and Assassin's Trophy to deal with any threats the opponent may play.

This deck focuses on using a combination of disruptive spells like Thought Erasure and Deputy of Detention, alongside powerful creatures like Lyra Dawnbringer and Seraph of the Scales, to pressure the opponent and control the board. By utilizing a mix of creatures and removal spells, it aims to establish early board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells and curve out efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and disruption.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures that can generate card advantage and gain life, such as Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Vraska's Contempt to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Planeswalkers like Vivien Reid adds additional card advantage and flexibility to the deck. Overall, the goal of this deck is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain board presence through the mid to late game with high-impact threats like Carnage Tyrant and Hydroid Krasis.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Seekers' Squire, and Jadelight Ranger to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down to deal with threats. Vivien Reid provides card advantage and additional removal. Carnage Tyrant is included as a solid finisher. Memorial to Folly helps with recursion and the mana base consists of lands that support the Golgari color combination. This deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and win through efficient creature-based combat.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and out-valuing them with card advantage. It utilizes a combination of removal spells like Bedevil and Lava Coil, counterspells like Ionize and Disdainful Stroke, and card draw engines like Search for Azcanta and Chemister's Insight. The deck's win conditions include powerful threats like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake, as well as the card advantage and burn potential of Expansion / Explosion. The mana base is designed to support the deck's tri-color requirements for Grixis Control strategy.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of direct burn spells, efficient creatures, and cheap spells that can be cast for less mana. By applying early pressure and maintaining a high tempo throughout the game, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Experimental Frenzy allows for card advantage and continuous threats, ensuring that the deck can maintain momentum and close out games swiftly.

The deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using low-cost red spells and creatures with strong abilities. By efficiently using cards like Skewer the Critics, Light Up the Stage, and Wizard's Lightning, as well as powerful creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler, the player aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan. The deck's aggressive strategy is further supported by cards like Shock, Lightning Strike, and Risk Factor, ensuring a fast-paced and relentless assault on the opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures with abilities that generate card advantage and value, such as Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Hydroid Krasis. These creatures are supported by removal spells like Cast Down and Assassin's Trophy to control the board and clear the way for aggressive attacks. The deck also contains planeswalkers like Vivien Reid and Vraska, Golgari Queen for additional value and versatility. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's powerful cards.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Hydroid Krasis in combination with removal spells like Cast Down and Assassin's Trophy to control the board. Vivien Reid provides card advantage and removal, while Carnage Tyrant and Hostage Taker offer additional threats and disruption. The mana base allows for consistent color access to support the Sultai color combination. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent with efficient threats and disrupt their game plan with removal spells, ultimately aiming to win through combat damage.
